required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Dural Puncture Epidural Technique Versus Conventional Epidural Technique for Adequate Anesthesia During Vaginal Surgeries

brief_summary.textblock: This study will be conducted on 81 patients of ASA grade I and II aged from 25 to 55 years and presented for elective vaginal surgeries such as vaginal hysterectomy,repair of prolapse . Patients will be divided into three equal groups; group A control group for conventional epidural technique(n=27), group B for dural puncture epidural with spinal needle 27G(n=27) and group C for dural puncture epidural with spinal needle 25G(n=27). Randomization will be done using computer generated number and concealed using sequentially numbered,sealed opaque envelope

primary_outcome.description: After establishment of the selected technique, the sensation at sacral area should be assessed by a hypodermic needle as the loss of sensation at this sacral area indicate the initiation of the effective block that is needed to start the surgery. The variability in the techniques will depend on the earlier onset of sensory block at the sacral region.

arm_group.arm_group_label: spinal needle(27 g) within touhy needle(17 g)
spinal needle (25 g) within touhy needle (17g)

intervention.intervention_name: Touhy epidural needle(17 gauage) with Quincke spinal needle(27 gauage or 25 gauage), or touhy epidural needle (17 gauage) alone.
intervention.description: These are needles used for neuriaxial blockade at the level of epidural( touhy needle) and subarachnoid ( quincke spinal needle) spaces.
intervention.arm_group_label: spinal needle (25 g) within touhy needle (17g)
spinal needle(27 g) within touhy needle(17 g)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA I and II
- Height(150-170 cm)
Exclusion Criteria:
- patient refusal
- hypersensitivity to local anesthetic drugs
- bleeding disorders and coagulopathy(platelets count less than 80000,INR less than 1.5 or therapeutic dose of anticoagulant).
